definition:
A **sole sufficient operator** or a **sole sufficient connective** is an
operator that is sufficient by itself to define all of the operators in
a specified set of operators.

In logical contexts this refers to a logical operator that suffices to
define all of the Boolean-valued functions, $f : X \to \mathbb{B}$,
where $X$ is an arbitrary set and where $\mathbb{B}$ is a generic
2-element set, typically
$\mathbb{B} = \{ 0, 1 \} = \{ \mathrm{false}, \mathrm{true} \}$, in
particular, to define all of the finitary Boolean functions,
$f : \mathbb{B}^k \to \mathbb{B}$.
